body.instruction: Use the context of the sentence to decide the Latin vocabulary and case for the word in bold type. Select the card to check your answer.
body.instruction_textversion: Use the context of the sentence to decide the Latin vocabulary and case for the word in bold type. Select the card to check your answer.

diem – Accusative case

front.content: On this day, the slave teaches the students.
front.textversion: On this day, the slave teaches the students.

back.textversion:

die – Ablative case

front.content: Legal matters of the family are handled by the male head of the household.
front.textversion: Legal matters of the family are handled by the male head of the household.

back.textversion:
Show Answer

res – Nominative case

front.content: We give to the things that matter most to us.
front.textversion: We give to the things that matter most to us.

back.textversion:
Show Answer

rebus – Dative case

front.content: Which of the things in the household is of importance to the father?
front.textversion: Which of the things in the household is of importance to the father?

rerum – Genitive case
